result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Michael Kundinger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques deft  to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & deft guilty. 
Kara Weiland, victim witness coordinator makes statement on behalf of victim- H.E.
COURT ORDERS: 
15CF1089 Ct. 1- 10 years WSPS: 5 years IC, 5 years ES. Ct. 3- 5 years WSPS: 2 years IC, 3 years ES, to run consecutive with one another with total IC of 7 years, followed by 8 years ES. Ct. 6- 3 and a half years WSPS: 18 months IC, 2 years ES, concurrent to other sentencing.
15CF512 Ct. 2: 9 months MCJ, concurrent to all other sentencing. 
15CF783 Ct. 1: 10 years WSPS, 5 years IC, 5 years ES, concurrent to other sentencing. 
15CF784 Ct. 3- 45 days MCJ. Pay $600 fine plus cc, concurrent to all other sentencing. 24 months drivers license revocation, administrative credit granted for time already served. 24 months IID to be installed immediately, time will not begin until deft obtain's valid license. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Ct. 6- 9 months MCJ, concurrent to all other sentencing. 
15CF785 Ct. 2- 3 and a half yeras WSPS: 18 months IC, 2 years ES. Ct. 4- 9 months MCJ, concurrent to all other sentencing. 
15CF787 Ct. 1- 12 years WSPS: 7 years IC, 5 years ES, concurrent to others
15CM831 Ct. 1- 6 months MCJ, concurrent to all other sentencing. 
15CM2199 Ct. 2- 30 days MCJ, concurrent to all other sentencing. 
COURT CONDITONS of ES: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two. No contact with victims- Edelberg's. In 15CF787- Pay back restitution to victim of $1,000. In 15CF783- Pay back restitution of $18,119.63 to West Bend Mutual. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. Defendant is eligible for both prison programs- Challenge Incarceration Program & Susbtance Abuse Program.

Defense has stipulation on jail credit
Atty Kurszewski to provide order to court to sign if has stipulation, if not will have hearing on it.
COURT ORDERS: Restitution to be paid first to victims- Edelburg's before West Bend Mutual if DOC allows it. 
Atty Kurszewski addresses furlough letter court received
COURT denies furlough request
Deft is remanded to MC Sheriff's Dept to be transported to Dodge County.
